subject: Re: [junit] Re: Can anyone help me see how to usefully work with JUnit in a big project, please?
msgSnippet: ... I guess if it hasn t worked for you, and you are speaking from your experience, there s still the chance that TDD has worked on a larger scale for other
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

>Now consider a more realistic example, such as an application that is
>dealing with five database tables, each with four to ten columns, each of
>which needs to be mapped to Java objects in a sensible way (i.e. not
>necessarily mapping the tables and the objects one-to-one) and should also
>include business methods and objects to make it easier to perform
>domain-specific operations.
>
>Using TDD to drive such a design is guaranteed to lead to an architecture
>that will be focused on solving micro-problems and that will totally miss
>the big picture.
>
>
I guess if it hasn't worked for you, and you are speaking from your
experience, there's still the chance that TDD has worked on a larger
scale for other teams and you're just not aware of it. Eh? If you
concede that, you can ask some questions.


Michael Feathers
